name: San Marino
description: San Marino, a microstate nestled within Italy, boasts a remarkably preserved medieval landscape and a rich history. Its dramatic, rolling hills, dotted with ancient fortresses and charming villages, offer a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural heritage.  The country’s strategic location and stable economy contribute to its appeal as a tourist destination and a center for international finance.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: San Marino is one of the smallest countries in the world.
quickFacts.detail: Its compact size contributes to its unique character and preservation of historical sites.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of San Marino is relatively small.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in the three historic cities: Serravalle, Borgo Maggiore, and San Marino.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The capital city is named after the country.
quickFacts.detail: San Marino is a historic walled city and the political and administrative center.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: San Marino uses the Euro as its currency.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: However, the Marinesche dialect, a Romance language, is also spoken.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: San Marino has a robust economy.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is driven by finance, tourism, and light industry.

climateData.title: Mediterranean Climate
climateData.description: San Marino experiences a Mediterranean climate characterized by warm, dry summers and mild, wet winters.  The mountainous terrain influences local weather patterns, creating cooler temperatures at higher elevations.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming and blossoming of wildflowers across the hillsides.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are hot and dry, with clear skies and abundant sunshine.  This is peak tourist season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a decrease in temperatures and a vibrant display of fall foliage. Rainfall increases.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild and wet, with occasional snowfall in the mountains.  It's a quieter time to visit.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Titano
naturalWonders.description: Mount Titano, the heart of San Marino, is a dramatic mountain range that dominates the landscape. Its steep slopes and imposing peaks offer stunning panoramic views.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain range is composed of metamorphic rocks and is characterized by its rugged terrain and numerous caves. It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out

naturalWonders.name: Monte Conero
naturalWonders.description: Monte Conero is a dramatic coastal cliff formation along the Adriatic Sea, offering breathtaking views and unique geological features.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The cliffs are composed of sedimentary rock and are sculpted by the relentless force of the sea. It's a haven for diverse birdlife.
viewingTips: Wear sturdy shoes for exploring the cliffs

ecosystemData.title: Monti Sibillini National Park (Adjacent)
ecosystemData.overview: While technically in Italy, the Monti Sibillini National Park significantly influences San Marino's ecosystem and biodiversity. This mountainous region provides a vital habitat for numerous plant and animal species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: The flora of San Marino is diverse, with a mix of Mediterranean and alpine species.

statistics.details: Several plant species are found only in San Marino.
Spring brings a spectacular display of wildflowers.

notableSpecies.name: Sanmarinesche Iris
notableSpecies.significance: A rare iris species endemic to San Marino.

notableSpecies.name: Alpine Edelweiss
notableSpecies.significance: A high-altitude flower found in the mountain regions.

biodiversityCategories.name: Fauna
biodiversityCategories.description: San Marino is home to a variety of bird species, including raptors and migratory birds.

statistics.details: A diverse range of bird species inhabit the region.
San Marino is a stopover point for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Golden Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic raptor that nests in the mountains.

notableSpecies.name: Barn Owl
notableSpecies.significance: A common owl species found throughout the country.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in San Marino
activities.description: San Marino offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from gentle hikes to challenging climbs.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the stunning mountain trails and coastal paths of San Marino.

activities.name: Monte Titano Hike
activities.description: A popular hike to the summit of Monte Titano, offering panoramic views.

activities.name: Monte Conero Coastal Trail
activities.description: A scenic coastal trail along Monte Conero, offering stunning views of the Adriatic Sea.

activityCategories.name: Cycling
activityCategories.description: Cycle through the picturesque countryside and along the coastal roads.

activities.name: San Marino Loop
activities.description: A circular route through the historic towns and countryside.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves

safety: Inform someone of your hiking plans
